Details: Reviewed industry standards for laptop testing. Looked at manufacturer and refurbisher guidelines.
Created step-by-step procedures for hardware and software checks. Included battery, display, and port tests.
Identified tools and software needed for verification. Used open-source utilities where possible.
Writing detailed protocols for each test type. Including pass/fail criteria and troubleshooting tips.
Run pilot tests to validate procedures and protocols. Adjust based on real-world results.
Update protocols based on pilot results and staff feedback.
Create a template for recording and archiving test outcomes.
